item.title: Karen add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Guard well your spare moments. They are like uncut diamonds. Discard them and their value will never be known. Improve them and they will become the brightest gems in a useful life." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Karen add a quote by Madeleine Albright
item.description:
"There is a special place in hell for women who don't help other women."
(Keynote speech at <i>Celebrating Inspiration</i> luncheon with the WNBA's All-Decade Team, 2006)" -- Madeleine Albright

item.title: Karen add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "We must learn to reawaken and keep ourselves awake, not by mechanical aids, but by an infinite expectation of the dawn, which does not forsake us even in our soundest sleep. I know of no more encouraging fact than the unquestionable ability of man to elevate his life by a conscious endeavour. It is something to be able to paint a particular picture, or to carve a statue, and so to make a few objects beautiful; but it is far more glorious to carve and paint the very atmosphere and medium through which we look, which morally we can do. To affect the quality of the day, that is the highest of arts." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Karen add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Our life is frittered away by detail. Simplify, simplify." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Karen add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "As you simplify your life, the laws of the universe will be simpler; solitude will not be solitude, poverty will not be poverty, nor weakness weakness." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Karen add a quote by Thomas S. Monson
item.description: "Reading is one of the true pleasures of life. In our age of mass culture, when so much that we encounter is abridged,adapted, adulterated, shredded, and boiled down, it is mind-easing and mind-inspiring to sit down privately with a congenial book..." -- Thomas S. Monson

item.title: Karen add a quote by Thomas S. Monson
item.description: "Stick to a task 'til it sticks to you. . .for beginners are many, but finishers few." -- Thomas S. Monson

item.title: Karen add a quote by Paul Newman
item.description: "I don't like to discuss my marriage, but I will tell you something which may sound corny but which happens to be true. I have steak at home. Why should I go out for hamburger?" -- Paul Newman

item.title: Karen add a quote by Thomas S. Monson
item.description: "Choose your love. Love your choice." -- Thomas S. Monson

item.title: Karen add a quote by J. E. McCulloch
item.description: "No other success can compensate for failure in the home." -- J. E. McCulloch
